result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Walt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the Drug Abuse surcharge.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jacob L Walt
Current: 1643 N Alpine Road, Suite 104, Rockford, IL 61107 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 10395 Glen Abbey Close, Rockford, IL 61107 United States

Defendant Jacob L Walt in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Jacob L Walt in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:49 PM Court calls case.

State addresses the Court.

State moves to dismiss and read in Count 1 and Count 2. 
Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4. 
This is a joint recommendation.
Atty Sheets concurs.

Court believes it is not necessary to have a waiver of preliminary hearing due to the fact that Count 1 and Count 2 are being dismissed and read in.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 4

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions AttorneySheets  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Guilty
Count 4: Guilty

There is no reason why this Defendant cannot be sentenced today.

BY THE COURT:
Count 3:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs
Pay drug abuse surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Count 4:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs
Pay drug abuse surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Granting Permission to Withdraw as Counsel
Copy letter re: Motion to withdraw

Defendant Jacob L Walt in court. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's father in Court and informs that they want to get another attorney for representation.  Court schedules a status 08-17-15 at 9:00 a.m.  Defendant can call in.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jacob L Walt in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter (special appearance. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Possession w/ Intent-THC, Possess Drug Parapharnalia, Possession of Narcotics, Possession w/ Intent-Psilocin.

State requests a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
